info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 4:29PM PDT until August 27 at 7:30PM PDT by NWS Hanford CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Mariposa.
* WHEN...Until 730 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yosemite National, Yosemite Valley, Badger Pass Ranger Station, Bridalveil Creek Campground, Camp 4 Campground and Yosemite Glacier Point. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PDT THIS EVENING
